text: Can you send screenshots of how you’ve set your workflow ?

I have a Custom Event (Webhook) for Companies.
When an external application calls the Webhook it looks fine on the external application.
But on HubSpot it doesn't fire the associated Workflow and shows no completion data on the Webhook.

Can anyone help?

```This is the response I get from HubSpot:

{
    "statusCode": 202,
    "headers": {

This is exactly what I was looking for, very well explained. Thank you so much for taking the time to make the video, I really appreciate it.

No problem — I use this all the time in workflows. I pass json data, (or I even save json data to records) and then turn them into objects in the code and work with them.

Passing variables into the next custom code action allows you to have single function code blocks, so it is much easier to determine when an error happens in the process.

Passing variables also allows you to keep the minimum time limit for functions in mind. Only having a limited amount of time for each custom code block, you can avoid timeout issues
